definition: to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to

sentences.english: Nevermind the fact that you were lying to him, too.
sentences.chinese: 更别提事实上你也在对他撒谎。

sentences.english: He discerned that Howard was lying.
The CIA chief—like his bosses and those before him—is a liar.
sentences.chinese: 中央情报局长如同他的老板和前几任一样，都在撒谎。

sentences.english: He tried to look AS sober AS he could, but the police could immdiately tell he wAS lying!
sentences.chinese: 他尽量装的镇定，但是警察一眼就发现他在撒谎。

sentences.english: I would lie and say that I am actually half white.
sentences.chinese: 我撒谎说自己实际上有一半的白种人血统。

sentences.english: Can only lie to others in exchange for betraying the truth that has been late?
sentences.chinese: 只有撒谎出卖别人才能换回那已经迟到的真相？

sentences.english: So, I want you to lie as to that number. Okay?
sentences.chinese: 这道问题要撒谎，明白吗？

sentences.english: So here is another prominent reason why do men cheat and lie.
sentences.chinese: 因此这是一个更突出的男人为什么要撒谎的原因。

sentences.english: Who is really telling the truth and who is the liar?
sentences.chinese: 谁真正讲出了事实谁又在撒谎呢？

sentences.english: Every time you lie the hands on your clock will move.
sentences.chinese: 你每次撒谎，你钟上的表针将移动一次。

sentences.english: Tom lied to the boss about his work.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆就自己的工作情况对老板撒谎。

sentences.english: They'll all lie. Leastways all but the nigger.
sentences.chinese: 他们都在撒谎，那个黑人可能除外。

sentences.english: So Potiphar's wife told lies about Joseph so he ended up in prison.
sentences.chinese: 所以波提法的妻子撒谎导致约瑟坐监。

sentences.english: When Shelly says he's the harshest grader on campus, he isn't lying.
sentences.chinese: 当薛立说他是全校评级最严苛的老师时，他没有撒谎。

sentences.english: Do not trust any good news out of china. Chinese lie.
sentences.chinese: 别盲信从中国传出来的好消息，中国人会撒谎的。

sentences.english: The results found that average men lie 1,092 times every year - roughly three a day.
sentences.chinese: 而女性平均每年撒谎728次，约合一天2次。

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
